messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: 7297, entered the residence in order to conduct his portion of the investigation. At about 12:31am, Investigator Lewis, with the assistance of Chauffer Rodney Robinson rolled the decedent over and placed her in a body bag. When the decedent was moved, investigators observed a single spent casing in the pool of blood where the decedent had been laying. Technician Muhammad photographed and collected the spent casing, which was identified as a

9mm Luger at 12:31am. during a home invasion burglary. There were two eyewitnesses to the incident, who were inside the residence at the tie of the shooting, Darceleen Commodore and Earlitta Taylor, and the witnesses were being transported to the Homicide Office for interviews. Sergeant McMullen advised Detective Morton there was a blood trail from the interior hallway were the victim is located to North Derbignay Street. Detective Morton observed the H-10983-09 PAGE 16 At that point the witness observed her sister unresponsive and bleeding on the floor at the entrance to the bedroom. Gordon stated he would kill the witness if the police arrived while he was inside the residence. Both perpetrators then exited the residence with n money, or car keys. The witness notified then police. At 2:30AM Crime Lab Technician Tamika Rogers, Unit 5137, conducted gunshot residue test on both Darceleen Commodore and Earlitta Taylor at the Homicide Office. Coroner's Office Day Records from Detective David Trehan. The documents officially classified the shooting deaths of Patrice Commodore and Jessie Bibbins as a Homicides. At 9:00AM Detective Morton met with witness, Darceleen Commodore at her residence regarding her encounter with Reynell Payne. Commodore advised the Detective that Reynell Payne pressured her to say her son wasn't one of the perpetrators and the older gentleman was the perpetrator. Commodore states the statement given to 1815 Carondelet Street, was developed as a suspect.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Investigator LewisOfficer Context: Assisted by Chauffer Rodney Robinson, he rolled the decedent over and placed her in a body bag, finding a spent casing in the process.Officer Role: InvestigatorOfficer Name: Technician MuhammadOfficer Context: Photographed and collected the spent casing identified as a

9mm Luger at the crime scene.Officer Role: TechnicianOfficer Name: Sergeant McMullenOfficer Context: Advised Detective Morton of a blood trail leading from the interior hallway to North Derbignay Street.Officer Role: SergeantOfficer Name: Detective MortonOfficer Context: Conducted investigations, was informed by Sergeant McMullen about the blood trail, and met with Darceleen Commodore regarding her encounter with Reynell Payne.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Crime Lab Technician Tamika RogersOfficer Context: Conducted gunshot residue tests on Darceleen Commodore and Earlitta Taylor at the Homicide Office.Officer Role: Crime Lab TechnicianOfficer Name: Detective David TrehanOfficer Context: From the Coroner's Office Day Records, he officially classified the shooting deaths as Homicides.Officer Role: Detective
